sentences.english: Dedicated specifically for the preservation of the remains of the Living Buddha Stupa.
sentences.chinese: 靈塔，專門用於保存活佛遺體的佛塔。

sentences.english: The first eight stupas were created to hold the Buddha's remains.
sentences.chinese: 最初的八座佛塔中安放的就是釋迦牟尼的佛骨舍利。

sentences.english: That lifetime, rotating mountains, waters and stupas.
sentences.chinese: 那一世，轉山轉水轉佛塔。

sentences.english: Buddhist stupas are monuments holding holy relics.
sentences.chinese: 佛寺中的佛塔最初用來存放佛教聖物。

sentences.english: Three of us stood in front of the stupa .
sentences.chinese: 三人站在佛塔前的合照。

sentences.english: A king of kings is worthy of a pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 王中之王是值得建佛塔的。

sentences.english: But the French Quarter grocery store muffuletta remains the definitive version.
sentences.chinese: 但法國區食品店的木佛塔仍然是最經典的一種。

sentences.english: Wandering around a mouse in the pagoda on top of an home.
sentences.chinese: 一隻四處漂泊的老鼠在佛塔頂上安了家。

sentences.english: Thousands of Buddhist pagodas and Confucian temples spotted the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 數以千計的佛塔和孔廟散佈在風景區。

sentences.english: Tabinshwehti placed new spires on the chief Mon pagodas.
sentences.chinese: 莽瑞體在孟人的主要佛塔上加建了新的塔頂。

sentences.english: The "Great Stupa" was constructed by Emperor Asoka some time in the third century BC.
sentences.chinese: 這座“大佛塔”爲阿育王在公元前三世紀所建。

sentences.english: Inside there is a pagoda from which there is a panoramic view of the city.
sentences.chinese: 寺內有佛塔，是眺望南京全景的最佳觀景點。

sentences.english: A solemn pagoda is keeping guard for the desolate plateau.
sentences.chinese: 莊嚴的佛塔，固守着這片蒼涼的高原。

sentences.english: They come into their own when candles are placed inside during a full moon.
sentences.chinese: 在滿月的時候，佛塔裏點上蠟燭，與月光同輝。

sentences.english: Many years ago, I led a group of pilgrims from Shwebo to visit pagodas in Mandalay and Rangoon.
sentences.chinese: 多年以前，我領一個朝聖團從雪布去曼德勒參觀佛塔。

sentences.english: Only the north pagoda and temple is well preserved.
sentences.chinese: 只有北方佛塔和寺廟是保存完好。

definition: stupa/tower venerating the ashes of the Buddha
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
Buddhist image/statue of Buddha or Bodhisattva/CL:尊[zun1], 張|张[zhang1]
niche for statue (esp. Buddhist, Christian etc)
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
